item.title: Iron Man locomotion techniqu
item.description: You are now Iron Man So the technique that I chose to implement among the three previous ones is the Iron Man one. This is because it is the one that fits the most in the parkour but also because it is the one that hyped me the most. I first thought that the implementation will be very easy but I encountered some issues that I was not expecting at all !

item.title: Homework 3: Locomotion techniques
item.description: Context The main idea of this homework was to find three original locomotion techniques that could be implemented in a VR Parkour. The parkour was already implemented in Unity by @wenjietseng and is available on GitHub. I quickly had some ideas for that and ended up with more than three options. Later on we will have to implement one of those and I will post about it. I kept the ones that I thought were the best, let’s get started.

item.title: Introduction to Unity
item.description: Roll a Ball The purpose of this course was to introduce us to Unity while building our first game “Roll a ball”. I in fact had already a bit of experience on Unity but not too much, and I’ve never did the Roll a Ball game so I thought I will give it a try. Well things were not as simple as what I imagined. The last time I used Unity was in 2018 and I kept the version I installed back then on my PC.

item.title: Homework 2: Ultimate Display
item.description: Ultimate Display I was very confused about the article until I realized it was from 1965. What the author, Ivan Sutherland, describes is very interesting. He is foreseeing some technical breakthroughs like eye tracking or haptic technology in times where the mouse is just being invented ! I think that what he presents actually fits into the Reality-Virtuality Continuum of Milgram but not as a discrete point. I would rather say that it is an area inbetween augmented reality and augmented virtuality within the continuum.

item.title: Homework 1 : Hyper Reality
item.description: First scenario This hyper reality is displaying a whole lot of information all around the user. This could be very unconvenient for someone who is doing something that requires attention, let’s say driving. You are in the middle of the highway, driving at 130kph and suddenly your boss calls and his face pops right in the middle of your field of view. Then you see and hear ads all around you, it will be completely impossible to focus.

item.title: My First Post
item.description: I just got started with Hugo, it was pretty straight forward. The only problem I had is that I used sudo apt-get to install it but didn’t compile at first with the theme I chose. The reason was because sudo apt-get gets an old version of Hugo (0.40 I think) and the theme needed 0.60 or superior so I reinstalled it manually. Looking forward to post about this week homework later.
